results.title: The Fallen idol. The Winslow boy
results.creator_credit: Anthony Asquith, G Turney-Smith, Oswald Hafenrichter, Anatole de Grunwald, Carol Reed, London Film Productions, Graham Greene and Terence Rattigan
results.brief_description:
Based on a true incident, ‘The Winslow Boy’ (produced by Anatole de Grunwald, directed by Anthony Asquith) tells the simple story of a father’s impassioned fight to clear the name of his son - a young naval cadet expelled from college after being found guilty of theft. Arthur Winslow is certain of his son’s innocence, and yet is impeded in his task to retain the boy’s honour, that is until a famous KC and political leader, Sir Robert Morton, agree to help their cause. Cast includes Robert Donat, Cedric Hardwicke and Margaret Leighton.
Based on a short story by Graham Greene, ‘The Fallen idol’ (produced and directed by Carol Reed) is a sensitive study of the way in which a young boy interprets the strange and seemingly illogical behaviour of the adults who surround him. He witnesses the adulterous relationship that develops between the butler Baines, whom he worships, and a typist at the foreign embassy in London where his father works. He also sees Baines’ wife fall to her death while spying on the couple and the boy’s interpretation of events places Baines in a perilous situation. Cast includes Michele Morgan, Ralph Richardson, Sonia Dresdel and Jack Hawkins.

results.title: The Inspector general = Happy times
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Jerry Wald and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An assistant elixir salesman (Danny Kaye) is mistaken by the Russian villagers of Brodny as the infamous Inspector General - an envoy of Napoleon. The tale’s comic impetus is driven by bungling officials seeking to appease the false general and the tongue twisting talents of the inimitable Danny Kaye. Cast includes Danny Kaye, Walter Slezak, Barbara Bates and Elsa Lanchester. Freely adapted from Nikolai Gogol’s classic Russian story.

results.title: They came to Cordura
results.creator_credit: Robert Rossen, William Goetz and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Set during a Mexican expedition in 1916, Gary Cooper is cast as a self doubting Army Major, who believing himself to be a coward, relieves himself of his combat duties and is assigned the inglorious task of locating five battle heroes and ensuring their safe passage to the Cordura military base. The five heroes are worthy of a medal of honour, something that appeals to the “cowardly” Army Major. The mission is going along smoothly until the arrival of an American woman accused of treason (Rita Hayworth), as the film evolves into an intense study of character and endurance. Cast also includes Van Heflin and Tab Hunter.

results.title: Billy Madison
results.creator_credit: Tamara Davis, Robert Simonds and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Billy Madison’s future is made, or so he thought. He is heir to his father’s fortune, he’s passed high school compliments of his father’s cheque book, and he spends his days lazing by the pool, drinking and chasing women. His world is thrown into chaos when his father informs him of plans to hand over the family fortune, the Fortune 500 company, to vice president, and resident weasel, Eric Gordon. Billy makes a bet with his father to regain what is rightfully his. The bet is that Billy will go back to school and pass every year level within 24 weeks. Working against him is Eric, determined to retain the company, while working for him is an attractive teacher whose very interested in her new student. Cast includes Adam Sandler, Bradley Whitford, Darren McGavin and Bridgette Wilson.

results.title: The Hand of death = Shaolin men
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Raymond Chow and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: John Woo wrote and directed this action film starring Jackie Chan, Samo Hung, Dorian Tan and James Tien. Following the breakup of their group after an invasion from the rival Manchus, 8 Shaolin renegades form their own resistance group. They train under their old leader, until he deems them ready enough to challenge the Manchus and save the Chung Dynasty. Poorly dubbed into English.

results.title: Dragonheart
results.creator_credit: Rob Cohen, Raffaella De Laurentiis and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Bowen (Quaid) is a knight dedicated to the Old Code, a noble creed of honour in a time long ago when majestic fire breathers soared through the skies. Bowen dedicates his time to instructing worthy pupils of the Old Code. He is disillusioned when one of his pupils, Prince Einon, becomes a cruel King, and Bowen loses faith in the idealism that was once the source of his inner strength. Believing Einon’s soul to have been poisoned by a dragon, Bowen vows to destroy all dragons - without question or mercy. It is on this revenge quest for the good soul of Prince Einon that Bowen meets Draco (voice provided by Sean Connery), a dragon whose power, strength and wit are not easily defeated. As man and dragon contest in a life or death struggle, a friendship is formed that will change the face of the medieval world forever. Cast includes Dennis Quaid, David Thewlis, Pete Postlethwaite, Julie Christie and Dina Meyer.

results.title: The Trouble with Harry
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The trouble with Harry is that he’s dead, and while nobody else seems to mind, everybody thinks they are responsible for his death. After many burials and unearthings of the corpse, and a few blossoming romances between the major characters, the real cause of Harry’s death is revealed, and Harry troubles nobody again. “The Trouble with Harry” is a quirky comedy-mystery set in the autumnal splendour of New England. It is a decidedly different film from Hitchcock, in which Shirley Maclaine makes her screen debut. Includes music score by Bernard Herrmann. Cast includes Edmund Gwen, John Forsythe, Shirley Maclaine, Mildred Natwick and Jerry Mathers. Based on the novel by Jack Trevor.

results.title: Prime Suspect: the lost child
results.creator_credit: John Madden, Paul Marcus and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: When a 14 month old child disappears, Jane Tennison (Helen Mirren) is called in to lead the investigation. The case hits a raw nerve with Jane who is recovering from an abortion, as well as affecting DI Muddyman (Jack Ellis), for reasons he doesn’t wish to disclose. There is only one prime suspect, Chris Hughes (Robert Glenister), a recovering paedophile who is now living with a woman who has two young children. Tennison’s investigation is hampered by the lack of staff allocated to a kidnapping, the numbers increase, as does the personal involvement, when the case turns into a murder investigation. The Criminal psychologist (Stuart Wilson) who treated Hughes is convinced Hughes is incapable of murder, although he is capable of being pushed over the edge due to intense police scrutiny during the investigation. With Muddyman involved, this is a very probable scenario.

results.title: Star trek II: the wrath of Khan
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Meyer, Robert Sallin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: It is the 23rd century and the starship U.S.S. Enterprise is on a routine training mission when an urgent communication from Space Laboratory Regula One (home of the Genesis project), is received by Admiral James T Kirk. Kirk’s old enemy, Khan, a genetically enhanced human from the Eugenics War, has appropriated a top secret device named Project Genesis and is using the universe threatening device in a deadly game of revenge. Aided by his band of genetic supermen made possible by the Project, Khan gains control of a Federation Starship and begins a desperate mission to gain control of the Enterprise. Cast includes William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley and Kirstie Alley.

results.title: Star trek III: the search for Spock
results.creator_credit: Leonard Nimoy, Harve Bennett and Harve Bennett Productions
results.brief_description: The third in the series of feature films based on the original television series by Gene Roddenberry is set in the 23rd Century, the planet Genesis has been born, but at a great and terrible price - the death of Captain Spock. As per tradition, his body is consigned to deep space and the battered starship Enterprise limps back home. Lt. Saavik and Dr. David Marcus arrive on the forbidden planet to begin their research, unaware that their discoveries are also of great importance to the Klingon Battle Commander Kruge (played by Christopher Lloyd), who will stop at nothing to gain control of the secrets of this new world for the Klingon Empire. The revelations regarding Genesis will impel Captain Kirk and the Enterprise crew on a mission so personal and dangerous that they will have to confront the final frontiers of revolutionary science and the arcane rituals of Vulcan mysticism. Cast includes William Shatner, DeForest Kelly, James Doohan, George Takei, Walter Keonig, Nichelle Nichols, Merrit Butrick and actor/director Leonard Nimoy, around whom the whole story revolves.
